      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  GameMap.BFSIterator
      A new BFS iterator for the tile map built to iterate over the map's structure in breadth fist order and only to a certain depth

      • GameMap

        public GameMap(java.io.File f)
        Creates a new GameMap by reading a file from disk. Each terrain Tile will have a distinct letter representing that tile The file format will be as follows: The first line will be two integers designating the spawn location of all characters separated by commas. After that, each line will have the same width, and a single character will represent the tile type(tile characters below). If a portal tile is encountered, the next string (separated by a comma) will be read as the target destination for the portal. Tile Character Representations: D = TileDesert F = TileForest M = TileMountain P = TilePlain S = TileSwamp O = TilePortal W = TileWasteland A = TileWater
        Parameters:
        f - the file the map will be read from. This will also turn into the GameMap's name;

        public java.awt.Point getSpawnLoc()
        Returns the closest position to the spawn location of the map that is not occupied by a GameCharacter
        Returns:

      • setTile

        public void setTile(int i,
           int j,
           Tile new_tile)
        Sets a tile. Links the tile to the other tiles around it. Does no bounds checking.
        Parameters:
        i - the x coordinate.
        j - the y coordinate.
        new_tile - the new tile.

      • getTile

        Parameters:

        y - the rel_y coordinate.
        Returns:
        the tile.

      • getBFSIterator

        public GameMap.BFSIterator getBFSIterator(Tile start,
                                 int depthLimit)
        Returns a new BFS iterator with the set starting position and the depth you want to go to.
        Parameters:
        start - the starting tile
        depthLimit - the farthest the iterator will go before returning null
        Returns:
